Award.AwardTitle: Support US-based Students to Attend the BioImage Informatics Conference 2017 (BII 2017)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration: The BioImage Informatics (BII) conference is among the foremost meetings on image informatics for life sciences. It aims to establish a unique communication network for researchers working in the fields of image processing, computer vision, and image-based analytics, for applications in biology. Since the first conference in 2005, it has been attracting computer scientists and biologists from all over the world. The BII 2017 will be held in Banff, Canada from September 19th to September 21st, 2017. The conference will include invited talks by leading scientists, oral and poster presentations selected from peer-reviewed submissions, technical special sessions, as well as competitions and challenges. This award will fund a diverse set of graduate student participation in this important meeting.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The travel grant supported eleven US-based students to attend the BioImage Informatics Conference 2017 (BII 2017) held September 19-21, 2017 at Banff, Canada.  The BioImage Informatics Conference has been a premier international conference that brings together researchers working in the fields of image processing, computer vision and image-based analytics for applications in biology. It has consistently reflected the latest advances of bioimage analytics since 2005 and provides a unique communication network and exchange forum for the growing field.  By attending BII 2017, the travel grant awardees were able to make presentations, participate in high-quality talks and special sessions. They had the opportunity to interact with their peers as well as more experienced researchers from different universities. They learned frontier challenges and research progress in image analytics and large-scale data mining.  The reactions of the travel grant awardees were very positive. The students have ubiquitously found that attending BII 2017 was a great learning opportunity and provided benefits for their study and research. They have described the experience “inspiring”, “eye-opening”, “received many great suggestions” etc.. Overall, the experience of attending BII 2017 as supported by the travel grant is expected to enhance the participants’ competitiveness in conducting top-tier interdisciplinary research and subsequently boost their ongoing and future research endeavors.
